title: hREA and the Care Economy: From Accounting to Flourishing
description: Discover how REA accounting principles, implemented through hREA on Holochain, provide the foundation for the Elohim Protocol's vision of a coordinated care-based economy
purpose: Understand the technical and philosophical bridge between hREA's economic vocabulary and Elohim's care economy vision

contributorPresences.name: Lynn Foster
contributorPresences.contribution: Co-created the ValueFlows vocabulary specification that defines how economic activity is described in agent-centric networks. Decades of work on REA accounting and open value networks.

contributorPresences.name: Pospi
contributorPresences.contribution: Primary architect and developer of hREA - the Holochain implementation of ValueFlows. Built the GraphQL API and modular architecture that makes REA accounting work on peer-to-peer networks.

contributorPresences.name: Jillian Ada Burrows
contributorPresences.contribution: Core contributor to hREA development and the broader Holochain ecosystem. Helped shape the technical implementation that bridges REA theory to working code.

thumbnailAlt: Network of value flows connecting people

chapters.title: REA Foundations
chapters.description: The accounting model that makes value visible

steps.stepNarrative: Before we can build a care economy, we need an accounting system that can see care. REA provides the foundation.
learningObjectives: Understand the three core REA elements
Contrast REA with traditional double-entry bookkeeping
See how REA makes invisible labor visible

steps.stepNarrative: Agents are the humans (and organizations) who participate in economic activity. In hREA, they're first-class citizens.
learningObjectives: Understand agent identity in hREA
Learn about agent relationships and capabilities
See how care recognition attaches to agents

steps.stepNarrative: Events are the facts of economic life - what actually happened. This is where invisible care work becomes visible.
learningObjectives: Understand economic event structure
Learn the action vocabulary (produce, consume, work, etc.)
See how care work becomes recorded events

chapters.title: Planning and Coordination
chapters.description: How agents coordinate economic activity without central control

steps.stepNarrative: Before events happen, there are desires (intents) and promises (commitments). This planning layer enables coordination.
learningObjectives: Distinguish intents, commitments, and events
Understand offers and requests
See how promises become accountability

steps.stepNarrative: Value gets created through processes. Recipes document how work gets done, enabling knowledge sharing and coordination.
learningObjectives: Understand process inputs and outputs
Learn how recipes enable reusable workflows
See value chain visibility

chapters.title: Appreciation and Gift Economies
chapters.description: Beyond exchange: how hREA supports non-transactional value

steps.stepNarrative: Not all value flows are exchanges. hREA's Appreciation module is the technical key to supporting gift economies and care recognition.
learningObjectives: Understand appreciation vs. exchange
See how gift economies become legible
Connect appreciation to care tokens

chapters.title: The Care Economy Bridge
chapters.description: Connecting hREA infrastructure to Elohim's constitutional purpose

steps.stepNarrative: hREA implements ValueFlows. Elohim extends ValueFlows for care economies. Together, they form a complete stack.
learningObjectives: Understand the technical stack: hREA → ValueFlows → Elohim
See how Elohim extends ValueFlows concepts
Learn about constitutional flow control

steps.stepNarrative: The ultimate purpose: making invisible labor visible, so those who care can be recognized and flourish.
learningObjectives: Understand the value gap problem
See REA's solution to invisibility
Connect visibility to recognition to flourishing

chapters.title: The Okonkwo Family Story
chapters.description: Seeing hREA concepts applied in a care economy narrative

steps.stepNarrative: Follow the Okonkwo family as they discover how REA accounting reveals their true value creation - and how the network begins to close the gap.
learningObjectives: See REA concepts in narrative form
Understand the transition from extraction to recognition
Envision the care economy future

steps.stepNarrative: Test your understanding of how hREA provides the foundation for care-based economics.
learningObjectives: Validate understanding of core concepts
Apply concepts to scenarios
Demonstrate integration of technical and visionary understanding
